intro: Tricholepidium, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems, which are typical features of many plants in this family. The leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Tricholepidium species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including Europe, Asia, and North America. These plants are often found in grassy areas, meadows, and along roadsides, where they thrive in well-drained soils.
